description:
**Fix Overview**:

To resolve the Windows Update Stack elevation of privilege vulnerability (CVE-2024-21432) affecting various versions of Windows:

1. Identify the relevant KB article for your Windows version:
   - For Windows 11 Version 23H2: Apply KB5035853.
   - For Windows 11 Version 22H2: Apply KB5035853.
   - For Windows 11 Version 21H2: Apply KB5035854.
   - For Windows 10 for x64 and 32-bit Systems: Apply KB5035858.
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2 for x64 and 32-bit Systems: Apply KB5035845.
   - For Windows 10 Version 21H2: Apply KB5035845.

2. Download the appropriate update package from the official Microsoft Update Catalog:
   - [KB5035845](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5035845)
   - [KB5035858](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5035858)
   - [KB5035853](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5035853)
   - [KB5035854](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5035854)

3. Install the update based on your system architecture and version.

4. Restart your system to apply the changes once the installation is complete.

**Details**:
- This fix addresses the improper link resolution before file access vulnerability that could lead to elevation of privilege.
- Make sure to back up your data before proceeding with the update installation to prevent any potential data loss.
